conclusion: Analyze the motion of the blocks and the energy transformations involved.
Block A starts from rest at a height h.
Using conservation of mechanical energy, potential energy at height h is converted into kinetic energy at the bottom of the track.
Velocity of block A just before collision is v_A = sqrt(2gh).
Block A collides with block B and they stick together.
Velocity of combined mass (A + B) after collision is v = v_A / 3 = sqrt(2gh) / 3.
Kinetic energy of block A before collision is KE_before = mgh.
Kinetic energy of combined mass (A + B) after collision is KE_after = mgh / 3.
Heat generated during collision is Q = KE_before - KE_after = 2mgh / 3.
The heat generated during the collision of A and B is Q = 2mgh / 3.
